gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੈ ਰੇਤ ਖੇਤੰ ॥ ਨਚੇ ਭੂਤ ਪ੍ਰੇਤੰ ॥ ਕਰੈ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਚਾਰੰ ॥ ਤਜੈ ਬਾਣ ਧਾਰੰ ॥੪੩੨॥
transliteration: Girai Ret Khetan|| Nache Bhoot Pretan|| Darai Chitra Chaaran|| Tajai Baan Dhaaran||432||
translation: The warriors began to fall in the battlefield and the ghosts and fiends danced; the fighters, getting pleased, showered arrows.432.

gurmukhi: ਹਲੈ ਜੋਧ ਜੋਧੰ ॥ ਕਰੈ ਘਾੲਿ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੰ ॥ ਖਹੈ ਖੱਗ ਖੱਗੈ ॥ ੳੁਠੈ ਝਾਲ ਅੱਗੈ ॥੪੩੩॥
transliteration: Halai Jodh Jodhan|| Darai Ghaae Krodhan|| Khahai Khagg Khadgann|| Outhai Dhaal Aggad||433||
translation: The warriors challenging others in fury, inflicted wounds on them; with the collision of dagger with the dagger, the sparks of fire were emited.433.

gurmukhi: ਨਚੇ ਪੱਖਰਾਲੇ ॥ ਚਲੇ ਬਾਲ ਅਾਲੇ ॥ ਹਸੇ ਪ੍ਰੇਤ ਨਾਚੈਂ ॥ ਰਣੰ ਰੰਗ ਰਾਚੈਂ ॥੪੩੪॥
transliteration: Nache Pakkhraale|| Chale Baal Aale|| Hase Prêt Naachain|| Ranan Ran Raachain||434||
translation: The horses danced and the ghosts roamed; the fiends, laughingly were absorbed in war.434.

gurmukhi: ਨਚੇ ਪਾਰਬਤੀਸੰ ॥ ਮੰਡਿਓ ਜੁੱਧ ੲੀਸੰ ॥ ਦਸੰ ਦਿੳੁਸ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਭਯੋ ਘੋਰ ਜੁੱਧੰ ॥੪੩੫॥
transliteration: Nache Paarbateesan|| Mandio Juddh Eesan|| Dasan Dious Kruddhan|| Bhayo Ghor Juddhan||435||
translation: Shiva also fought, while dancing; and in this way, for ten days, this ire-full war was fought.435.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨਰ ਬੀਰ ਤਯਾਗਯੋ ॥ ਪਗੰ ਦ੍ਵੈਕ ਭਾਗਯੋ ॥ ਫਿਰਯੋ ਫੇਰਿ ਅੈਸੇ ॥ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੀ ਸਾਂਪ ਜੈਸੇ ॥੪੩੬॥
transliteration: Pounar Beer Tyaagyo|| Pagadg Dvaik Bhaagyo|| Phiryo Pher(i) Aise|| Krodhisaanp Jaise||436||
translation: Then the king, abandoning his spirit of bravery, ran for two steps, but then he rotated like the revengful snake.436.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨਰ ਜੁੱਧ ਮੰਡਿਓ ॥ ਜਰੰ ਓਘ ਛੰਡਿਓ ॥ ਤਜੇ ਵੀਰ ਬਾਣੰ ॥ ਮ੍ਰਿਤੰ ਅਾੲਿ ਤ੍ਰਾਣੰ ॥੪੩੭॥
transliteration: Pounar Juddh Mandio|| Jaran Ogh Chhandio|| Taje Veer Baanan|| Mritan Aae Traanan||437||
translation: Then he again began the war and showered arrows; the warriors discharged arrows and the death released them from the terror of the war.437.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੈ ਸਿੱਧ ਦੇਖੈ ॥ ਕਲੰਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਲੇਖੈ ॥ ਧਨੰ ਧਨੰ ਜੰਪੈ ॥ ਲਖੈ ਭੀਰ ਕੰਪੈ ॥੪੩੮॥
transliteration: Sabhai Siddh Dekhai|| Kakankrit Lekhai|| Dhanan Dhanan Janpai|| Lakhai Bheer Kanpai||438||
translation: All the adepts saw Kalki and repeated “bravo, bravo”; the cowards trembled on seeing him.438.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨ ਅਾਨ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਸਧਾਨ ਬਾਨ ਧਾਵਹੀਂ ॥ ਰੂਝ ਜੂਝ ਕੈ ਮਰੇਂ ਸੁ ਦੇਵ ਨਾਰ ਪਾਵਹੀਂ ॥
transliteration: Aan Aan Soormaa Sadhaan Baan Dhaav-heen|| Roojh Joojh Kai Daren Su Dev Naar Paav-heen||
translation: The warriors aiming the targets of their arrows marched forward and embracing martyrdom in the war, they wedded the heavenly damsels;

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਰੀਝ ਰੀਝ ਅੱਛਰਾਂ ਅਲੱਛ ਸੂਰਣੋਂ ਬਰੈਂ ॥ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ਬੀਨ ਬੀਨ ਕੈ ਸੁਧੀਨ ਪਾਨ ਕੈ ਧਰੈਂ ॥੪੩੯॥
transliteration: Su Reejh Reejh Achchhraan Alachchh Soornon Darain|| Prabeen Been Been Kai Sudheen Paan Kai Ddarain||439||
translation: The heavenly damsels, also being pleased, began to wed the warriors catching their hands after selecting them.439.

gurmukhi: ਸਨੱਧ ਬੱਧ ਅੱਧ ਹ੍ਵੈਂ ਬਿਰੁੱਧ ਸੂਰ ਧਾਵਹੀ ॥ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰੋਧ ਸਾਂਗ ਤੀਛਣੰ ਕਿ ਤਾਕ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰੁ ਲਾਵਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Sanaddh Baddh Addh Hvain Biruddh Soor Dhaab-hee|| Su Krodh Saan Teechhanan Di Taak Shhattru Laav-hee||
translation: The warriors, getting bedecked, fell on the direction of the opponents and striking sharp lances on the enemies;

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਜੂਝ ਜੂਝ ਕੈ ਗਿਰੈ ਅਲੂਝ ਲੂਝ ਕੈ ਹਠੀ ॥ ਅਬੂਝ ਓਰ ਧਾਵਹੀ ਬਨਾੲਿ ਸੈਨ ੲੇਕਠੀ ॥੪੪੦॥
transliteration: Su Joojh Joojh Kai Girai Aloojh Loojh Kai Hathee|| Aboodhe Or Dhav-hibanaae Sain Kathee||440||
translation: The persistent fighters are falling down after continued fighting and gathering their forces, are running in various directions here and there.440.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕਪਾ ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰਾਜਾ ॥ ਘਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਘੋਰੇ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਜਾ ਫਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਫੀਲੰ ਛਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਛੂਟੇ ॥ ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸੂਰੰ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੂਟੇ ॥੪੪੧॥
transliteration: Kaagaddaddan Kapaa Raagaddaddan Raajaa|| Ghaagaddaddan Ghore Baagaddaddan Baajaa|| Phaagaddaddan Pheelan Chhaadaddaddan Chhodhte|| Saagaddan Sooran|| Jaagaddaddan Jeete||441||
translation: The king trembled; the dreadful war-drums sounded; the elephants went out of control and the warriors fought with one-another.441.
